page.title: 04St MICHAEL'S CHURCH
page.content: One of the largest churches in Helston is St Michael's. The church has been changed twice since it was built. Inside the church there are forty-two rows of pews made from pitch pine. It has many plaques made of marble on the inside walls which commemorate some of the special people who are buried in the church. The church tower is about 150 feet high and contains six bells. From the top of the tower one may obtain a spectacular view of the town of Helston, Loe Pool, Loe Bar and Mounts Bay. The tower bells can be heard all over the town of Helston The church has a massive organ and on the East wall is a large stained glass window.
